commit_message:
Fix external network configurations for Mellanox

The external network type has been changed to local,
as a part of the fix of the following bugs:
bug/1272349
bug/1357298
bug/1357292
bug/1357298
bug/1260051

In This commit 'local' type is added to the ML2 type_drivers,
in case of choosing Mellanox, in order to support external
network changes.

Closes-bug: #1369988

Change-Id: I580a9e87550140a66eaf685dc0c4832c2e135463
Signed-off-by: Aviram Bar-Haim <aviramb@mellanox.com>

commit_message:
Fix external network configurations for Mellanox

The external network type has been changed to local,
as a part of the fix of the following bugs:
bug/1272349
bug/1357298
bug/1357292
bug/1357298
bug/1260051

In This commit 'local' type is added to the ML2 type_drivers,
in case of choosing Mellanox, in order to support external
network changes.

Closes-bug: #1369988

Change-Id: I580a9e87550140a66eaf685dc0c4832c2e135463
Signed-off-by: Aviram Bar-Haim <aviramb@mellanox.com>

commit_message:
Use cluster VIP instead of controller IP in test 'Deploy Heat HA'

In the system test 'Deploy Heat HA' controller IP was used to connect 
to keystone, in this case, in HA mode, need to use cluster VIP 
instead of internal controller IP to successfully connection to keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1369412

Change-Id: I8ce6f9094396a8b203aa9fe8c4b05bd8675199e1
(cherry picked from commit bbfeb5d4bbaaa7e2e50f81d45c9e4c8619429e8d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-15 14:36:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix ssh key specification in the README.rst

The ssh public key entries starts with key type
specifier like 'ssh-rsa', but the puppet module which consuming the ssh_key
 expects only the key part.

Also switching to the id_rsa.pub in the example, because usually it
contains just only one public key, what the users usually pushes to the servers.

The authorized_keys file is for the keys accepted by the user's machine
itself.

Change-Id: Ic92729b572582360495b3544e479de98cd3c02c0
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-25 06:33:36.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': "Fix ssh key specification in the README.rst

The ssh public key entries starts with key type
specifier like 'ssh-rsa', but the puppet module which consuming the ssh_key
 expects only the key part.

Also switching to the id_rsa.pub in the example, because usually it
contains just only one public key, what the users usually pushes to the servers.

The authorized_keys file is for the keys accepted by the user's machine
itself.

Change-Id: Ic92729b572582360495b3544e479de98cd3c02c0
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix ssh key specification in the README.rst

The ssh public key entries starts with key type
specifier like 'ssh-rsa', but the puppet module which consuming the ssh_key
 expects only the key part.

Also switching to the id_rsa.pub in the example, because usually it
contains just only one public key, what the users usually pushes to the servers.

The authorized_keys file is for the keys accepted by the user's machine
itself.

Change-Id: Ic92729b572582360495b3544e479de98cd3c02c0

commit_message:
Add method which returns cluster public VIP by id

When we want to connect to OpenStack services API which
are running on HA cloud, we need to have ability to get public
virtual IP address of deployed environment. So adding an
additional method to the FuelWebClient class for that.

Related-bug: #1369412
Change-Id: I98c8c323dd81f0b361b73050df29083e0d912211
(cherry picked from commit 146234cfa742fa73dcd3d41798297ff16497027e)

commit_message:
Revoke the tokens of group members when a group role is revoked

Fixes a bug introduced by the previous commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115338/

If revoke_api is not enabled, tokens of group members are not revoked
when a group role is revoked.

Change-Id: I7542ee775ddd6fd240ecb370a3e243e465accbb0
Closes-Bug: 1369664

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-16 11:02:33.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Change pysaml2 comment in test-requrements.txt.

    Even though the ``pysaml2`` library is used for Keystone2Keystone
    functionalities, Keystone will complain about missing dependency right
    after federation extension is enabled.
    Commend in the test-requirements.txt should be updated to reflect the
    situation.

Change-Id: Id4e615905574d5ad3d050bd8077b25f8327419ab
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change pysaml2 comment in test-requrements.txt.

    Even though the ``pysaml2`` library is used for Keystone2Keystone
    functionalities, Keystone will complain about missing dependency right
    after federation extension is enabled.
    Commend in the test-requirements.txt should be updated to reflect the
    situation.

Change-Id: Id4e615905574d5ad3d050bd8077b25f8327419ab

commit_message:
architecture property metadef should include valid enums

Nova defines specific values that can be used for CPU architecture. They are found here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/arch.py

The architecture property should include these values as enum choices.

Change-Id: I06e4d30a2ede0c05480ec7431abe72af80e1339c
Closes-bug: 1368965

commit_message:
virt: move assertPublicAPISignatures into base test class

The nova/tests/virt/test_driver.py has a useful method for
validating subclass APIs vs the base class contract. This
can be used in many places in Nova, so move it into the
base TestCase class for broader reuse.

Related-bug: #1369151
Change-Id: Ib49e888aae31fb0d47c1d11f35648e9cb2595c75

commit_message:
consolidate apirequest tests to single file

There was one stray apirequest test for a formatting check in
test_api. Bring it into the test_apirequest to for logical cohesion in
the code. This should also make it simpler for people to expand on
this validation later in one place if they want to.

Change-Id: Ib9a09034b1b677b462eb0384396cd9bc64f73045
Related-Bug: #1306479

commit_message:
ensure that we safely encode ec2 utf8 responses

The ec2 response layer assumed that all strings coming back for
results were always ascii, and exploded horribly if they weren't due
to the use of a str() function late in the game. This updates the code
to use safe_encode correctly when the object gets rendered.

This also adds unit tests for the rendering functionality in
ec2/apirequest so that we can actually feel confident that it does the
right things with unicode.

Change-Id: I348a728e3559fdbf0d1bc66616cc278c3370cd29
Closes-Bug: #1306479

commit_message:
Drop verbose and useless nova-api log information

Instead of printing two consecutive debug logs if there is a body, print
one. If no body, only display the method being called and not the
content-type as that isn't used for debugging. Shrink log output to make
log files smaller and easier to read.

Change-Id: I0e07876eee0064bd429ce9ea3254f7b95b991511

commit_message:
Add method which returns cluster public VIP by id

When we want to connect to OpenStack services API which
are running on HA cloud, we need to have ability to get public
virtual IP address of deployed environment. So adding an
additional method to the FuelWebClient class for that.

Related-bug: #1369412
Change-Id: I98c8c323dd81f0b361b73050df29083e0d912211

commit_message:
Use cluster VIP instead of controller IP in test 'Deploy Heat HA'

In the system test 'Deploy Heat HA' controller IP was used to connect 
to keystone, in this case, in HA mode, need to use cluster VIP 
instead of internal controller IP to successfully connection to keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1369412

Change-Id: I8ce6f9094396a8b203aa9fe8c4b05bd8675199e1

commit_message:
Add support for bulk message delete in v1

Bulk message delete was missing in the client. This patch implements
that feature for both v1 and v1.1.

commit_message:

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use for/else rather than a guard value

Python has a useful for/else pattern that will execute the else block
if break inside the loop wasn't called, which allows us to dispose of
the guard value used to tell if a node has been created.

Change-Id: Ie29c9eed54911c64a420ce93f2920e640a5c9aac

commit_message:
Leave symlinks for RabbitMQ state paths

As an operator, we instinctively expect e.g. logs to be
in /var/log while debugging. Placing a symlink allows
us to make debugging easier.

Change-Id: I86cfea07230ee3554f792b0b00ab366a60779d64

commit_message:
Add description in ProphetStor cinder volume driver

Add this to the description for ProphetStor FC and iSCSI drivers:
ProphetStor Fibre Channel and iSCSI drivers add support for ProphetStor
Flexvisor through OpenStack Cinder. ProphetStor Flexvisor enables commodity
x86 hardware as software-defined storage leveraging well-proven ZFS for
disk management to provide enterprise grade storage services such as snapshots,
data protection with different RAID levels, replication, and deduplication etc.

renew again.

Change-Id: I69e83df508ce42b0d937865cad6211acaca5342f
Closes-Bug: 1369415

commit_message:
Adds verbosity to child cell update log messages

Child Cells frequently update their parents with their capabilities and
capacities. The debug log message contains the capabilities or capacities
that are being updated. This patch adds the names of the parent cells to
which the information is being sent to the debug log message.

Change-Id: Ic34191da191369e64a016c8300a8da294aaa9e07
Closes-Bug: 1351301

commit_message:
Lock attach_volume

There are some issues with instance and volume cleanup when the volume
is not in a fully attached state so it will be safer to not attempt a
terminate_instance while there are attachments in progress.

Change-Id: I4347794e51004a881bf4ef5ee30f65ac28773e51
Closes-Bug: #1355348

commit_message:
Dnsmasq uses all agent IPs as nameservers

Add dhcp option which provides all agent IPs
which will be used as nameserver entries when
neutron uses multiple dhcp agent per network and
when there is no dns nameserver provided by the
neutron server.

Change-Id: I639a844bba212a731616851ff479a5e735612cf8
Closes-bug: #1259482
(cherry picked from commit 2afff147c45f97a0809db40ad072332fb37ccd8d)

commit_message:
Fail tempest if 0 tests are run

This commit adds a check to subunit-trace to fail if the test run
doesn't actually run anything. Despite technically passing without
running anything, if you're passing a regex to testr that runs 0 tests
that is probably an error, so treat it as such. This also uncovered a
bug in the test_wrappers unit test where the test was using a bad test
regex but still passsing. Since we start enforcing it here the unit
test is also updated to use the proper regex.

Change-Id: I109a8cd6eb731e5b8daf5cc2d6a76498ddd48c6d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-15 16:09:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_wrappers.py'], 'message': 'Properly print STDOUT and STDERR in test_wrappers

If the unit tests in test_wrappers.py fail while using subprocess to
run the wrapper scripts STDOUT and STDERR are incorrectly used in the
exception method. Currently str() on the stringIO object is being
used for the message, which will only print information about the open
file. This commit fixes this by calling the read() method on the pipe
objects to print their contents.

Change-Id: I8fbf560fe2c706f1de96bb089730ec3f92fe3327
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Properly print STDOUT and STDERR in test_wrappers

If the unit tests in test_wrappers.py fail while using subprocess to
run the wrapper scripts STDOUT and STDERR are incorrectly used in the
exception method. Currently str() on the stringIO object is being
used for the message, which will only print information about the open
file. This commit fixes this by calling the read() method on the pipe
objects to print their contents.

Change-Id: I8fbf560fe2c706f1de96bb089730ec3f92fe3327

commit_message:
Use oslo_debug_helper and remove our own version

With the latest version of oslotest, we can now take advantage
of a common oslo_debug_helper script.
We can now remove our own homebrewed version, minor changes to
tox.ini were needed.

Change-Id: I992244897eac7471c14988c34b8d140827fd65aa

 * We should raise original exception during transaction.
   It allows to see the right response codes from API:
     workbook-create (if already exists) - conflict 409 (was 400)
     action-update (if doesn't exist) - not found 404 (was 400)
     action-delete (if doesn't exist) - not found 404 (was 400)

Change-Id: I85164c10682da3204884c59a7576593924508647

commit_message:
Delete explicit raising DBError from transaction

 * We should raise original exception during transaction.
   It allows to see the right response codes from API:
     workbook-create (if already exists) - conflict 409 (was 400)
     action-update (if doesn't exist) - not found 404 (was 400)
     action-delete (if doesn't exist) - not found 404 (was 400)
     and etc.
 * Fixed sqlalchemy test to not assign property 'id' in entities.

Change-Id: I85164c10682da3204884c59a7576593924508647

commit_message:
Add pysaml2 to requirements.txt.

pysaml2 library is required for the federation extension in Keystone.
Due to missing dependency in the requirements.txt file, Keystone will
raise ImportError exceptions. This patch adds pysaml2 dependency to the
requirements.txt file.

Closes-Bug: #1369986
Change-Id: I3892e8ba3f1ec4559608ce437cd152d0c9b4c154

commit_message:
Introduce havana initial state

This patch replaces folsom initial state and all migrations
from folsom to havana, with a new, configuration independent
initial db state, corresponding to the havana release.

In order to avoid large modules, "init ops" modules have been
created for all plugins, service plugins, and extensions.

Some migrations after the havana release were amended or
removed to reflect the new initial state being introduced.

Partially-implements: blueprint reorganize-migrations

Change-Id: I47bfd0d26fad1373013ae0d5716266ca40c493c6

commit_message:
Allow filtering by region in swift-recon

The option "-r" is already used, thus only "--region" is used to specify
filter by region.

Change-Id: If769f2f3191c202933b03b48fe0f22b7c94a4dd6
Closes-Bug: 1369583

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-11 13:37:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_interface.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/radware/test_plugin_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': "Remove faulty .assert_has_calls([])

Some UT use <mock>.assert_has_calls([]) as a way to check if mock
wasn't called - this doesn't work because assert_has_calls only checks
if passed calls are present in mock_calls and hence it is always true
regardless of whether mock was called or not. This can lead to falsely
passed tests.

Change-Id: I1be5327854cc3dc2f5b3733f2bad78200cfbbfd2
Closes-Bug: #1368234
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove faulty .assert_has_calls([])

Some UT use <mock>.assert_has_calls([]) as a way to check if mock
wasn't called - this doesn't work because assert_has_calls only checks
if passed calls are present in mock_calls and hence it is always true
regardless of whether mock was called or not. This can lead to falsely
passed tests.

Change-Id: I1be5327854cc3dc2f5b3733f2bad78200cfbbfd2
Closes-Bug: #1368234

commit_message:

 * if we don't provide result of the task,
   json.loads() will fail

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-16 11:46:47.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/shell.py', 'mistralclient/tests/unit/v2/test_cli_tasks.py', 'mistralclient/commands/v2/tasks.py'], 'message': 'Add task-get-parameters command

 * Task parameters can be a huge size and getting
   them should be the separate command.
   Otherwise table task-list become unreadable.
 * Unit tests on task-get-result and task-get-output

Change-Id: If86a69d24786f73d3b3c297d0b8288336a1a5433
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add task-get-parameters command

 * Task parameters can be a huge size and getting
   them should be the separate command.
   Otherwise table task-list become unreadable.
 * Unit tests on task-get-result and task-get-output

Change-Id: If86a69d24786f73d3b3c297d0b8288336a1a5433

commit_message:
use TRUE in SQL for boolean var

The "allocated" variable was defined to be a boolean type
and in postgresql this type is enforced,
while in mysql this just maps to tinyint and accepts both numbers and bools

Closes-Bug: #1368251
Change-Id: If324c8b83e490e150085d044ac61360b647522ac

subject: Allow passing mysql users w/o db
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-23 22:13:37.000000000', 'files': ['elements/mysql-common/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/50-mysql-users'], 'message': "Allow passing mysql users w/o db

The 'database' field was previously required, but there are situations
in which we only want to connect to MySQL but don't need any access to
a particular database. The most obvious of these is for running 'SHOW
STATUS' for the purpose of monitoring.

Change-Id: Icfdb0fe0831d06b38ca4f6357b4bac5c345d2d22
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow passing mysql users w/o db

The 'database' field was previously required, but there are situations
in which we only want to connect to MySQL but don't need any access to
a particular database. The most obvious of these is for running 'SHOW
STATUS' for the purpose of monitoring.

Change-Id: Icfdb0fe0831d06b38ca4f6357b4bac5c345d2d22

commit_message:
Allow clean_up with missing image ref

This change allows clean_up to continue with missing image_source
in Node.instance_info. This previouly failed in cases where:

* A node failed to deploy and so didn't have image_source
* A node was migrated from nova-baremetal

Change-Id: I03543adc74f9da83fff58e0cffe34f36a055e19a
Closes-Bug: 1368984

[{'created': '2014-09-11 03:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ofagent/agent/ofa_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "ofagent: Remove broken XenAPI support

ofagent has code for agent-on-DomU support inherited from OVS agent.
However, it's incomplete and broken.  Because ofagent uses a direct
OpenFlow channel instead of ovs-ofctl command to program a switch,
the method to use the special rootwrap can not work.

Closes-Bug: #1368006
Change-Id: I0bb25a296d1f1e65c233ece6deaef6c095d78707
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
ofagent: Remove broken XenAPI support

ofagent has code for agent-on-DomU support inherited from OVS agent.
However, it's incomplete and broken.  Because ofagent uses a direct
OpenFlow channel instead of ovs-ofctl command to program a switch,
the method to use the special rootwrap can not work.

Closes-Bug: #1368006
Change-Id: I0bb25a296d1f1e65c233ece6deaef6c095d78707

commit_message:
Fix for floating ip association and deletion

Added code to associate fip to a vm in VSD, if
the fip was already associated with the vm port
in Neutron. Also added code in fip deletion,
to get the correct router id based on the check
if the fip is associated to a Neutron port or
not.
Closes-Bug: #1350469
Change-Id: I1aa24f420f656043086a4f501b15722216b843e9

commit_message:
Remove useless check in _rpc_update_firewall

Firewall_db_mixin.update_firewall returns an updated firewall or raises
an error (if the firewall is not found), that's why checking if its
result is evaluated to False is not required

Change-Id: Ib4e2fa0920783728b8e1cc8597b3edf78e098b52

commit_message:
Don't allow user to set firewall rule with port and no protocol

Creating firewall rules specifying a destination port and/or a source
port without a protocol, generates rules without src or dest port
restriction. This was a real security issue for cloud users.

This patch generates a 400 Bad request "Source/destination port
requires a protocol" in case of creation/update of firewall rules
specifying a destination port and/or a source port and without protocol.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1365961

Change-Id: I4a3a1d9ae7ec4b2a864b3edc83d65ef7f80cbba5

commit_message:
indexer: make entities be resources

This will allow to track their lifetime, owners, and also a few extra
fields.

Change-Id: I94c9951171a692f337353428384232b26b3c84fc

commit_message:
storage: implement archiving policy

This is a first step towards unifying entities archive storage based on
a template. The templates are for now hardcoded, but the next step will
be to have them defined via the REST API.

Change-Id: I0f277fba479b2f978ffddc5f788d5c4414468df9

subject: Test tables existence on v20 upgrade
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 16:06:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Drop tables on v20 downgrade

Like the other migration scripts, the downgrade operation on v20
should restore the database to the state prior to the upgrade.
The current script is leaving the configuration tables untouched
on downgrade, and absorb all exceptions being raised on subsequent
upgrades. The configuration tables may contain bad data that may
cause issues if not cleaned up.

This commit drops the configuration tables on downgrade. The
exception handler on the upgrade function has also been removed.

Change-Id: Ieb6a9adfb2e216f3a6f599fa67de8b39ae6802da
Closes-Bug: #1361389
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-27 23:31:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Test tables existence on v20 upgrade

The exception handler in the current code is absorbing all errors.
All unexpected migration errors are therefore not detected.

This commit tests the existence of tables to be created before
actually creating them. The "catch all" exception handler has also
been removed to allow unexpected errors to raise exceptions.

Change-Id: Ieb6a9adfb2e216f3a6f599fa67de8b39ae6802da
Closes-Bug: #1361389
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-09-03 18:11:21.000000000', 'files': ['trove/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/020_configurations.py'], 'message': 'Test tables existence on v20 upgrade

The exception handler in the current code is absorbing all errors.
All unexpected migration errors are therefore not detected.

This commit tests the existence of tables to be created before
actually creating them. The "catch all" exception handler has also
been removed to allow unexpected errors to raise exceptions.

Change-Id: Ieb6a9adfb2e216f3a6f599fa67de8b39ae6802da
Closes-Bug: #1361389
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Test tables existence on v20 upgrade

The exception handler in the current code is absorbing all errors.
All unexpected migration errors are therefore not detected.

This commit tests the existence of tables to be created before
actually creating them. The "catch all" exception handler has also
been removed to allow unexpected errors to raise exceptions.

Change-Id: Ieb6a9adfb2e216f3a6f599fa67de8b39ae6802da
Closes-Bug: #1361389

commit_message:
Only consider tags that look like versions.

pbr has been allowing any tag (e.g. 'fred') to be a version - but fred
is clearly not a version! Since git describe cannot validate versions
for us today, we need to perform the describe calculations ourselves.

In order for this to work on Python3, a missing method __hash__ needed
to be added to SemanticVersion.

Change-Id: I09fa54231e77ae7671aa6f84eb91fd655e49ab25
Closes-Bug: #1356784

commit_message:
libvirt: fix bug when releasing port(s)

During the process of deleting an instance, if
serial_console is enabled it has to check domain for
allocated port(s) to be released - Currently this is doing
after the domain has been undefined from libvirt which creates
a bug. This patch fixes the problem by moving this part of code before
undefining the domain.

Also 5fa74bc0b2 moves that part of code inside the method
_detach_encrypted_volumes which has nothing to do here.

Change-Id: Ie187748deff7b0143d1ca26e767c6665746094c5
Closes-Bug: #1366832

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-11 14:42:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "CLI support for queue existence and metadata operations

This patch extends the queues operation supported by the CLI.
It also renames some of the previously added features to make
them more consistent with their behaviour.

Features added:
- Check queue existence
- Set queue metadata
- Get queue metadata
- Get queue stats

Some examples:
	$ openstack queue exists myqueue
	$ openstack queue set metadata myqueue
	$ openstack queue stats myqueue

The above assumes Keystone is installed and has an endpoint
configured for Marconi. In order to bypass this in a non-Keystone
based deployment, the user can pass Marconi's url manually:

    $  openstack --os-token test
                 --os-url http://127.0.0.1:8888
		 queue exists myqueue

Partially-Implements: blueprint cli
Co-Author-by: Victoria Martnez de la Cruz <victoria@vmartinezdelacruz.com>
Change-Id: Idcc455a04b12a6e55ed077d221f6d3ca2ef055f8

commit_message:
CLI support for queue existence and metadata operations

This patch extends the queues operation supported by the CLI.
It also renames some of the previously added features to make
them more consistent with their behaviour.

Features added:
- Check queue existence
- Set queue metadata
- Get queue metadata
- Get queue stats

Some examples:
	$ openstack queue exists myqueue
	$ openstack queue set metadata '{"key":"value"}'
	$ openstack queue stats myqueue

The above assumes Keystone is installed and has an endpoint
configured for Zaqar. In order to bypass this in a non-Keystone
based deployment, the user can pass Marconi's url manually:

    $  openstack --os-token test
                 --os-url http://127.0.0.1:8888
		 queue exists myqueue

Partially-Implements: blueprint cli
Co-Author-by: Victoria Martnez de la Cruz <victoria@vmartinezdelacruz.com>
Change-Id: Idcc455a04b12a6e55ed077d221f6d3ca2ef055f8

commit_message:
If dependency not in global reqs exit with a 1

Don't silently remove dependencies not in global reqs, instead let them
fail installation.

We must also remove the following projects which do not have stable/havana
branches, and are thus testing against master:

 - ironic (and client)
 - oslo.messaging

Note: this assumes that devstack will terminate if this fails.

(cherry picked from commit 1b725bd52e3c6b2ab96acb1ff2800bca034b438d)

Conflicts:
	tests/test_update.py

Change-Id: I23be4c2084e07a6b60b64347af9b4c5338b06ada

commit_message:
Send more than 1 message in messages_get_many

A bug in falcon prevented this test to be meaningful. That bug has been
fixed and now we can serialize several messages ids in a query
parameter.

Change-Id: Ida8d790fc6222c00b24e24a7a4c303d5b3d16351

commit_message:
Start adding support for v1.1

This patch adds basic support for the API version 1.1. It basically
re-uses the specs and implementations from v1 since the API hasn't
really changed much.

Future patches will add support for the new methods and other changes.

Partially-Implements blueprint: api-v1.1

Change-Id: I40d02d6c2d3b932725f35204708d79785f59116b

commit_message:
fix up assertEqual(None...) check to catch more cases

To finally close out bug #1280522 it turned out that our hacking check
to eliminate assertEqual(None, ...) was pretty sub optimal. The
perfect fix would actually use the tokenizer, however this is a better
regex which catches a few more missing bits in our codebase. It's
probably close enough for most of what we need.

Fix the relevant tests that would fail the updating hacking check.

Change-Id: Ic8cb1192e001409d827c8da55fe536681895944b
Closes-Bug: #1280522

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 07:44:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correct content-type management in SessionClient.request

Currently SessionClient.request never specifies content-type in
requests unlike HTTPClient.request. This change ensures content-type is
defined for requests with body using SessionClient.

Closes-Bug: #1368335
Change-Id: I909e055e5e59fa5870a28ebb0f171812acca0745
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-12 09:39:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correct Content-Type/Accept management in SessionClient.request

Currently SessionClient.request never specifies Content-Type/Accept
headers in requests unlike HTTPClient.request. This change ensures
Content-Type header is defined for requests with body and Accept
header is defined using SessionClient.

Closes-Bug: #1368335
Change-Id: I909e055e5e59fa5870a28ebb0f171812acca0745
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-09-13 10:42:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correct Content-Type/Accept management in HTTPClient/SessionClient

Currently SessionClient.request never specifies Content-Type/Accept
headers in requests where HTTPClient.request always specifies json
Content-Type/Accept even with "--request-format xml" option ... requests
succeed because neutron deduces Content-Type/Accept from url suffix when
defined.

This change ensures HTTPClient/SessionClient define Content-Type/Accept
headers when needed and align them with --request-format option.

Closes-Bug: #1368335

commit_message:
Correct Content-Type/Accept management in HTTPClient/SessionClient

Currently SessionClient.request never specifies Content-Type/Accept
headers in requests where HTTPClient.request always specifies json
Content-Type/Accept even with "--request-format xml" option ... requests
succeed because neutron deduces Content-Type/Accept from url suffix when
defined.

This change ensures HTTPClient/SessionClient define Content-Type/Accept
headers when needed and align them with --request-format option.

Closes-Bug: #1368335
Change-Id: I909e055e5e59fa5870a28ebb0f171812acca0745

commit_message:
glanceclient should not ever LOG.error

The information should be returned to the caller to handle the error
conditions, it shouldn't log it's own error because it doesn't have
enough context to know if that's really a problem under the
circumstances.

Change-Id: I24e2cb2664d1d86610e0afd3c2ebc79af8eef507

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8076, 'name': 'Vladik Romanovsky', 'email': 'vladik.romanovsky@gmail.com', 'username': 'vladik'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-28 17:02:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Catch InstanceInfoCacheNotFound on lifecycle event

Nova compute gets lifecycle events from libvirt which are handled by
ComputeManager.handle_event(). For lifecycle events, this method catchs
InstanceNotFound exceptions and log them at DEBUG level (it's a minor
error: "The instance was probably deleted"). But we can also receive an
InstanceInfoCacheNotFound from nova conductor.

I got an InstanceInfoCacheNotFound an a lifecycle event on OpenStack
Icehouse. It's unclear to me if it can also occur in Juno, but IMO it
wouldn't hurt to catch also the exception here.

Call stack:

* handle_events()
* handle_lifecycle_event()
* _sync_instance_power_state()
* instance.refresh()
* self.info_cache.refresh()
* (RPC call)
* [in nova conductor process] refresh() raises an InstanceInfoCacheNotFound exception

Change-Id: I4703ac873a0a3e43c9dd7162a14e518c39334bb4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Catch InstanceInfoCacheNotFound on lifecycle event

Nova compute gets lifecycle events from libvirt which are handled by
ComputeManager.handle_event(). For lifecycle events, this method catchs
InstanceNotFound exceptions and log them at DEBUG level (it's a minor
error: "The instance was probably deleted"). But we can also receive an
InstanceInfoCacheNotFound from nova conductor.

I got an InstanceInfoCacheNotFound an a lifecycle event on OpenStack
Icehouse. It's unclear to me if it can also occur in Juno, but IMO it
wouldn't hurt to catch also the exception here.

Call stack:

* handle_events()
* handle_lifecycle_event()
* _sync_instance_power_state()
* instance.refresh()
* self.info_cache.refresh()
* (RPC call)
* [in nova conductor process] refresh() raises an InstanceInfoCacheNotFound exception

Change-Id: I4703ac873a0a3e43c9dd7162a14e518c39334bb4

commit_message:
Catch InstanceInfoCacheNotFound on lifecycle event

Nova compute gets lifecycle events from libvirt which are handled by
ComputeManager.handle_event(). For lifecycle events, this method catchs
InstanceNotFound exceptions and log them at DEBUG level (it's a minor
error: "The instance was probably deleted"). But we can also receive an
InstanceInfoCacheNotFound from nova conductor.

Call stack:

* handle_events()
* handle_lifecycle_event()
* _sync_instance_power_state()
* instance.refresh()
* self.info_cache.refresh()
* (RPC call)
* [in nova conductor process] refresh() raises an
* InstanceInfoCacheNotFound exception

Patch for Juno:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117567/

Change-Id: I6ab5094c7e153a4bebfc9d161a36dc924604fd12

subject: Fix Devstack docs for zsh users
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-15 23:44:10.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Fix Devstack docs for zsh users

The current docs fail with the following error:
$ image=$(nova image-list | egrep "$DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME[^-]" | awk '{print $2 }')
zsh: bad math expression: operand expected at `^-'

With this change, these docs work as expected for zsh users.

Change-Id: I56c39718cfe40208f62ea4786d684f6b24431ed9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Devstack docs for zsh users

The current docs fail with the following error:
$ image=$(nova image-list | egrep "$DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME[^-]" | awk '{print $2 }')
zsh: bad math expression: operand expected at `^-'

With this change, these docs work as expected for zsh users.

Change-Id: I56c39718cfe40208f62ea4786d684f6b24431ed9

commit_message:
augment "Neutron with NSX topology" section

- we recommend to dispose NSX nodes in OpenStack Management network if
  possible
- rename Neutron_nsx_topology.png to _images/Neutron_nsx_l2.png that
  illustrates aformentioned topology
- otherwise NSX network must have L3 connectivity with OpenStack Public
  network; in this case Compute nodes must receive Public addresses
  (checkbox on Settings tab must be ticked)
- mention this in Known Issues for 5.1 release
- add figure for topology with L3 connectivity
- while here fix typo on figures ("Constrollers")

Change-Id: I6f7948a9bfa2b5c6e7cf6e8a3636d94f913a71d1
Closes-bug: #1367859

commit_message:
Information about VMware vCenter and NSX features is updated.

Following documents are updated:
- Terminology: links in the 'nsx' term added
- Planning guide:
-- Choose Network Topology: information about nsx added
-- Nodes and Roles: notes added
-- Preparing vSphere Integration: notes and limitations added
- Reference Architecture: notes added, HA setup diagram updated
- User Guide: screenshots updated, vcenter-deploy.rst updated,
  7310-nsx-deploy.rst, add screenshot with filled NSX settings

I added a link to the vCenter page for assigning roles.  The
screen shot was too small to really see the verbage about not
assigning a Controller node so I increased the size of that image
and others in the vicinity.

Implements: blueprint vcenter-documentation-update-fuel-5.1
Change-Id: Ibcb5c1b7cd2a286e2239d17d87ea49eb10930964

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-20 23:56:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Moved validate_edp from plugin SPI to end_engine

Now EDP engine is fully responsible on validation of data for
job execution.

Other changes:
* Removed API calls from validation to remove circular dependancy
* Removed plugins patching in validation to allow non-vanilla
  plugins testing
* Renamed job_executor to job_execution

commit_message:
Moved validate_edp from plugin SPI to edp_engine

Now EDP engine is fully responsible on validation of data for
job execution.

Other changes:
* Removed API calls from validation to remove circular dependancy
* Removed plugins patching in validation to allow non-vanilla
  plugins testing
* Renamed job_executor to job_execution

Change-Id: I14c86f33b355cb4317e96a70109d8d72d52d3c00
Closes-Bug: #1357512

commit_message:
Fix jsonschema>=2.4.0 message assertion

The jsonschema 2.4.0 release slightly changed some of the error messages
that are provided when validation fails. This patch updates the unit tests to
expect the proper string and avoid failing as a result by using regex
(.0)? instead of specific value.

Change-Id: Ifd41147fd6157038b102c78144d1f6cb16cc25e6
Closes-bug: #1359284
(cherry picked from commit 822c2f053f8aef6d75e82631c7881cb64b7fa0a7)

commit_message:
Document how to implement support for an ML2 driver

operations: 3000-ml2-create -- gives detailed steps
for adding support for a new ML2 driver to the MOS
ML2 infrastructure

terminology: ml2 -- defines ML2 and gives xrefs to
other documents with more information

Closes-Bug: 1348821

subject: mock.called_once_with() is not a valid method
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-16 13:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/test_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py'], 'message': 'mock.called_once_with() is not a valid method

The method called_once_with() of a mock object is non-op that tests
nothing. The real method is assert_called_once_with(), this patch is
fixing that.

Change-Id: Ie080411458d18a796e245cf9e2cfdf9a070082cb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
mock.called_once_with() is not a valid method

The method called_once_with() of a mock object is non-op that tests
nothing. The real method is assert_called_once_with(), this patch is
fixing that.

Change-Id: Ie080411458d18a796e245cf9e2cfdf9a070082cb

commit_message:
Improve the timestamp validation of ceilometer API

Currently, ceilometer API is lack of timestamp validation. Timestamp in
query should be checked if it can be parsed to iso timestamp, and raise
explicit exception if not.

Change-Id: I02cb2f30b00bde46bf8a0e4e161a0e2ce9d44c09
Closes-bug: #1270394

commit_message:
Add @validation.require_openstack() validator

This patch removes from @base.scenario(admin_only=False) argument.
That actually doesn't work and doesn't cover situation when we need
only users or admins or admins & users..

Add proper @require_openstack validator that actually checks
everything that is required.
So you can specify that only users or admin is required or both
users and admin are required.

Add missing "users" context in rally-scenario for scenarios that
use it.

Add missing "sla" sections in benchmarks

Reduce amount of iterations in "rps" benchmark

Change-Id: Ie92dbd473ee94c2073401c6da8dc2771c9dfaed8

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-17 07:56:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix delete versioning objects when previous is expired

When deleteing versioned objects proxy will try to restore the previous
copy. The COPY request will fail if the previous version is expired but
not handled by object-expirer.

This patch makes sure the previous copy exists before issueing COPY
request. If the previous copy doesn't exists it will try the one before
the previous version.

Closes-bug #1308446

Change-Id: I17f049ea3ef62723effae8086ec427f6e151cd9c

commit_message:
Fix delete versioning objects when previous is expired

When deleteing versioned objects proxy will try to restore the previous
copy. The COPY request will fail if the previous version is expired but
not handled by object-expirer.

This patch checks COPY respones on the previous copy, if it's
HTTP_NOT_FOUND(mostly because it's expired) proxy will try to restore
with the version before previous.

Closes-Bug #1308446
Change-Id: I17f049ea3ef62723effae8086ec427f6e151cd9c

commit_message:
Update how tokens are redacted

Using SHA-1 to match how Nova and Swift redact their tokens.
Was discussed in the below thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/045802.html

Here's what nova went with: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99511/
swift seem to be following suit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99632/

Change-Id: I3045d6d9d2a13770f4022dbbd474b34eb1032f6e
Closes-bug: 1329301

subject: Print traceback to stderr if --debug is set
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-15 20:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Print traceback to stderr if --debug is set

This change allows easier debugging of client related issues, with a
full traceback printed out when an uncaught error occurs in the client.
Previously, it could be hard to find the portion of code raising an
exception, with just the message from the exception being displayed.

Previous behaviour (with a rather artificial client error being raised):

    $ glance --debug image-list
    Contrived exception

Behaviour after this patch:

    $ glance --debug image-list
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/shell.py", line 590, in main
        args.func(client, args)
      File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/v1/shell.py", line 77, in do_image_list
        raise(Exception('Contrived exception'))
    Exception: Contrived exception
    Contrived exception

Change-Id: Id7b76b707e5fc16a0402dcb104ec40787e0ffbe2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Print traceback to stderr if --debug is set

This change allows easier debugging of client related issues, with a
full traceback printed out when an uncaught error occurs in the client.
Previously, it could be hard to find the portion of code raising an
exception, with just the message from the exception being displayed.

Previous behaviour (with a rather artificial client error being raised):

    $ glance --debug image-list
    Contrived exception

Behaviour after this patch:

    $ glance --debug image-list
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/shell.py", line 590, in main
        args.func(client, args)
      File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/v1/shell.py", line 77, in do_image_list
        raise(Exception('Contrived exception'))
    Exception: Contrived exception
    Contrived exception

Change-Id: Id7b76b707e5fc16a0402dcb104ec40787e0ffbe2

commit_message:
Add configuration required for neutron-nova events

Supply Neutron with Nova admin access that allow it to do a vif
callback.

This reverts commit e234bddee9834a389520754062153e1a4df6af3b, but
doesn't remove it from the history, since it doesn't allow this change
to be tested.

Change-Id: If2f1848be6cde1c3b5f1d84b037b1ea67dc0ae41
Closes-bug: #1293782
Co-Authored-By: Steve Kowalik <steven@wedontsleep.org>

commit_message:
Handle UnicodeDecodeError in log_http_response

Similar to commit dec9c9f35 and log_curl_request,
this ignores decoding errors when logging response
headers by passing errors='ignore' to safe_encode.

Change-Id: Ic915a7d8334e9473f300c9db670a3a8f5cda8976

commit_message:
Ensure the amqp options are present in config file

This change ensures that the amqp1 will be present into the
configfile even the required python module are not present and
also put them into the correct section, [oslo_messaging_amqp1].

Change-Id: I1005405d7ed51090495688eadbe400dbff7c3cc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 04:56:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Treat 404s as 200 on object delete in proxy

This change adds an optional overrides map to _make_request method
in the base Controller class.

  def make_requests(self, req, ring, part, method, path, headers,
                    query_string='', overrides={})

The overrides map is in the form:

    { <response>: <override response>, .. }

This allows a proxy controller to change status when appropriate.
The ObjectController in the DELETE method now passes an override map
to make_requests method in the base Controller class. Where the
override map is:

    { 404: 200 }

This if the first version (WIP), existing tests are being debugged.

Change-Id: Ibf969eac3a09d67668d5275e808ed626152dd7eb
Closes-Bug: 1318375

in the base Controller class.

  def make_requests(self, req, ring, part, method, path, headers,
                    query_string='', overrides=None)

Which will be passed on the the best_response method. If set and
no quorum it reached, the override map is used to attempt to find
quorum.

The overrides map is in the form:

    { <response>: <override response>, .. }

The ObjectController, in the DELETE method now passes an override map
to make_requests method in the base Controller class in the form of:

    { 404: 204 }

Change-Id: Ibf969eac3a09d67668d5275e808ed626152dd7eb
Closes-Bug: 1318375
", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2014-09-08 06:02:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Treat 404s as 204 on object delete in proxy

This change adds an optional overrides map to _make_request method
in the base Controller class.

  def make_requests(self, req, ring, part, method, path, headers,
                    query_string='', overrides=None)

Which will be passed on the the best_response method. If set and
no quorum it reached, the override map is used to attempt to find
quorum.

The overrides map is in the form:

    { <response>: <override response>, .. }

The ObjectController, in the DELETE method now passes an override map
to make_requests method in the base Controller class in the form of:

    { 404: 204 }

When overriding, the status isn't simply changed, we generate new
responses and add them to the bottom of the list and remove the
old overrided responses. They are moved to the bottom so the
best_response method will choose an existing valid (non-replaced)
204 over a replaced one (first 204 found in the list).
The overrided responses are being recreated in case they get chosen
by the best_response method (largest status value, no natural earlier
overrided value and/or the overrides generate a new quorum) and we
don't want to send back the body or reason for its old response.
I.E we don't want to send something back like:

  (204, 'Not Found', '', 'The resource could not be found.')

Change-Id: Ibf969eac3a09d67668d5275e808ed626152dd7eb
Closes-Bug: 1318375
", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-09-09 07:34:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Treat 404s as 204 on object delete in proxy

This change adds an optional overrides map to _make_request method
in the base Controller class.

  def make_requests(self, req, ring, part, method, path, headers,
                    query_string='', overrides=None)

Which will be passed on the the best_response method. If set and
no quorum it reached, the override map is used to attempt to find
quorum.

The overrides map is in the form:

    { <response>: <override response>, .. }

The ObjectController, in the DELETE method now passes an override map
to make_requests method in the base Controller class in the form of:

    { 404: 204 }

Statuses/responses that have been overridden are used in calculation
of the quorum but never returned to the user. They are replaced by:

    (STATUS, '', '', '')

And left out of the search for best response.

Change-Id: Ibf969eac3a09d67668d5275e808ed626152dd7eb
Closes-Bug: 1318375

commit_message:
Treat 404s as 204 on object delete in proxy

This change adds an optional overrides map to _make_request method
in the base Controller class.

  def make_requests(self, req, ring, part, method, path, headers,
                    query_string='', overrides=None)

Which will be passed on the the best_response method. If set and
no quorum it reached, the override map is used to attempt to find
quorum.

The overrides map is in the form:

    { <response>: <override response>, .. }

The ObjectController, in the DELETE method now passes an override map
to make_requests method in the base Controller class in the form of:

    { 404: 204 }

Statuses/responses that have been overridden are used in calculation
of the quorum but never returned to the user. They are replaced by:

    (STATUS, '', '', '')

And left out of the search for best response.

Change-Id: Ibf969eac3a09d67668d5275e808ed626152dd7eb
Closes-Bug: 1318375

commit_message:
Permit 'exceptions' to be omitted from HORIZON_CONFIG

Without this change, if HORIZON_CONFIG is defined in local_settings.py
and does not have an 'exceptions' entry, then horizon throws and
exception and fails to start.

Change-Id: I74f244974982d1c56ac36bdcc032d5acb2a0b274
Closes-Bug: #1368361

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-11 13:39:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Validate SoftwareDeployment with SoftwareComponent

This patch adds property validation for SoftwareDeployments that are
used in combination with SoftwareComponents. In this case, the
'actions' property of SoftwareDeployment is invalid since applicable

commit_message:
Validate SoftwareDeployment with SoftwareComponent

This patch adds property validation for SoftwareDeployments that are
used in combination with SoftwareComponents. In this case, the
'actions' property of SoftwareDeployment is ignored since applicable
actions will be defined by the SoftwareComponent resource.

Implements: partial-blueprint action-aware-sw-config

Change-Id: I788904272aa4b7d12849c8dca8df76898851c969

commit_message:
Avoid using the disk cache on volume initialisation

When caching is involved, the volume might be
unmapped before the copy actually hit the disk or the
VM starts booting before all of the data has been flushed,
which causes the VM to crash at an arbitrary point in time.

Closes-Bug: #1363016

Change-Id: I7a04f683add8c23b9125fe837c4048ccc3ac224d

commit_message:
Switch to a custom NotImplementedError

Some drivers/modules might raise NotImplementedError whereas we would
expect things to work. Skipping test when such an error is raised would
be a bad idea, we would know the test failed.
So let's switch to a custom NotImplementedError and let's skip test only
if this one is raised.

Closes-Bug: #1369556

Change-Id: Ie88a281787218f9aba13b6e662eb4d49d3e685d0

commit_message:
Bind9 zone file should end with a new line

This patchs add a new empty line at the end of the zone template.
Otherwise Bind9 complains with "named[21602]: $PATH/example.net._$ID.zone:18:
file does not end with newline"

Change-Id: Ib73ac32e8e793aa79114879ae0017dbfb725f813

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-03 18:48:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move apache config creation to start_keystone()

We currently cleanup keystone apache config during stop_keystone
when mod wsgi is enabled, but only create it during initial keystone
configuration.  Grenade expects to be able to stop and start the
service without reconfiguring it, using only the respective functions.
This moves rendering of the keystone apache site config to the start
function.

Change-Id: I9e57c9a763fbdb8c5737decfe797ba0e9894150b
Partial-bug: #136515

commit_message:
Split keystone mod wsgi config from start/stop

We currently cleanup keystone apache config during stop_keystone
when mod wsgi is enabled, but only create it during initial keystone
configuration.  Grenade expects to be able to stop and start the
service without reconfiguring it, using only the respective functions.
This moves cleanup of config from stop_keystone to cleanup_keystone,
and enables/disables the apache vhost during start/stop.

Closes-bug: #1365105

Change-Id: I9e57c9a763fbdb8c5737decfe797ba0e9894150b

commit_message:
HP 3PAR configurable ssh-host-key-policy

Cinder added configurable SSH strict key policy (RejectPolicy)
and configurable known_hosts_file.  This patch configures the
hp3parclient (used by the 3PAR drivers) using those settings.

Change-Id: I71fa7d8be28d1cb7c0102590e03cba994b6035a0
Closes-bug: 1365697

commit_message:
default=None is unneeded in config definitions

It's not required for setting config options, as it's the default, and
there were only 2 final places where it was set in the code, so we
should just clear that out.

Change-Id: I33dd0c002e48a5f5d26047b7f87643fce67f9e64
Closes-Bug: #1323975

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-13 07:47:36.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
swift: Respect the OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY setting

The swift API client connection does not respect the
OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY setting in the local_settings.py.

As a result a SSL verfication error happens with a
self-signed certificate.

Closes-Bug: #1311357.

Change-Id: I907a8f7c5c631adfaf2ca66385749bb8e86734f2
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix incorrect exception when bdm with error state volume

When boot from an error state volume, compute api will raise
InvalidBDMVolume exception which is incorrect. It should raise
InvalidVolume exception with appropriate prompt message.

Note that the v2 API extension is not updated to handle the
InvalidVolume exception since the API already handles the
base exception Invalid. A unit test is added to verify the
coverage.

Change-Id: I9dbc3f68e68b6d452077bc47717ad0fafd5640ac
Closes-Bug: #1361517
Co-authored-by: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Pass flag to engine service to patch parameters

For stack-update, add a new PATCH ReST API and a new CLI
argument named existing-parameters to indicate that the set
of parameters should be patched over the existing parameter
from the DB.  A new method in environment handles
the patching.

Partially-implements: blueprint troubleshooting-low-level-control
Partial-Bug: 1224828
Change-Id: I802e0dca44926be3a3f45fcaa995c866a4abf998

commit_message:
libvirt: set pae for Xen PVM and HVM

The Physical Address Extension (PAE) enables paging to produce physical
addresses with more that 32 bit (2^32 bytes, 4 GBytes), namely it
extends the physical address space to 64 GBytes (2^36 bytes).

When spawning a 32 bit image in Xen PVM or HVM, PAE should be enabled in the
hypervisor so as to ensure that it is able to run properly. According to
the Xen documentation it can be enabled safely: "In general you should
leave this enabled and allow the guest Operating System to choose whether
or not to use PAE. " [1]

[1] http://xenbits.xen.org/docs/unstable/man/xl.cfg.5.html#pae_boolean

Closes-Bug: #1100697
Change-Id: If8d8ebc38efd969d96a1953446d72e72691734b3

commit_message:
Reuse existing disable_rollback in stack-update

This patch makes `stack-update` command to change the `disable_rollback`
bit of the stack IF AND ONLY IF explicitly requested on CLI.

In order to facilitate this, `--rollback` CLI argument to `stack-update`
is added (accepting values from 1, on, true, t, 0, off, false, f and similar)
to explicitly set disable_rollback property of the stack on stack update.
If this argument is omitted, the value of disable_rollback
of the stack to be updated will be implicitly used by heat engine.

The boolean switch '--enable-rollback' is deprecated with appropriate
message (although the default behavior is effectively changed).

Change-Id: I235198ec04bfb192fcbfa4e2e3e618b64c99d3df
Closes-Bug: #1324366

commit_message:
Fix 'os-start/os-stop' server actions for V2.1 API

'os-start/os-stop' server actions were missed for V2.1 API.
This patch converts 'os-start/os-stop' server action for V2.1 API

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3.

Closes-Bug: #1367575

Change-Id: I8b0f27fb639034d368bcc1fc51d20daf9c2cdeb5

commit_message:
Fix border colors for Firefox

Added 'background-clip:padding-box' to default zebra-stripe styles.
This makes borders visible for odd row, action column in Firefox.

Closes-bug: 1364274

commit_message:
Allow forceDelete to delete running instances

Currently attempting to force delete a running instance
fails while a normal delete can succeed. This changes the
behaviour of force_delete so any instance can be deleted
and not just ones which have already been soft deleted.

Also catch InstanceIsLocked exceptions at the API layer
and now also don't need to catch InstanceInvalidState
exceptions since they are no longer raised

DocImpact: forceDelete will now delete any instance and not
  just ones which have already been soft deleted

Change-Id: I06a476701ccb47d8f7fd6e43c394ccb3fac2b3aa
Closes-Bug: 1351001

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-13 07:57:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
Sync oslo cliutils module

Changes -
 * Add field_labels parameter to cliutils.print_list
 * Fix response_key parameter usage in BaseManager
 * Remove unused/mutable default args
 * Centralize bash-completion in Novaclient
 * Fix E126 pep8 errors

commit_message:
Enable mask_password to handle byte code strings

Byte code strings passed into mask_password cause the coersion to
six.text_type to fail with a UnicodeDecodeError.  The code can
work with the byte code string, but the incoming message may be
an i18n object that has to be coerced.

The temporary fix is to ignore the UnicodeDecodeError on the
coersion.   A better solution will be provided for Kilo.

This is related to cinder bug #1368527

Change-Id: Ifb60942b7cdfe4d184f59012c29caa9fa71fb053
Closes-bug: #1366189
Closes-bug: #1368527

commit_message:
Parametrize table_prefix_separator in hbase

table_prefix_separator is hardcoded to be an underscore (happybase
default). This fix adds the possibility to parametrize this value using
a parameter in ceilometer database configuration. An example is:
hbase://localhost:9090/?table_prefix=ceilo&table_prefix_separator=.

Change-Id: I761977dadce102641f91930ebf75db8177d03a6b
Closes-Bug: #1331374

commit_message:
zmq: provide sample_default for rpc_zmq_host opt

Latest oslo.config has a sample_default attribute which the sample
config file generator will use rather than attempting to detect
dynamic defaults like those that depend on the current machine's
hostname.

Change-Id: I5dab43efe293895ca8a998141e1723881dc90334

subject: Use cfgfilter to hide transport opts from API
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-09 12:56:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use cfgfilter to hide transport opts from API

Make use of the new cfgfilter module to ensure that the following
configuration options are not visible via the ConfigOpts instance
you pass to get_transport() or TransportURL.parse():

  transport_url
  control_exchange
  rpc_backend

Note that this may break some applications using oslo.messaging
currently but only because they depended on API semantics which were
documented as private. That said, we should ensure that integrated
OpenStack projects stable/icehose branches are fixed before we release
oslo.messaging 1.4.0 for Juno.

Also note that oslo.messaging.ConfFixture still registers all options
with the supplied ConfigOpts instead (ensuring that e.g. set_override()
works as expected) so the options will not be private in unit tests.

Finally, this uses cfgfilter from oslo-incubator but we should not
merge this until we are using cfgfilter from oslo.config proper.

Change-Id: I9c3bf74f13a820ce295aa77a2bbcd781778b5926
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-06-20 11:16:39.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/transport.py', 'oslo/messaging/openstack/common/cfgfilter.py', 'openstack-common.conf', 'tests/test_transport.py'], 'message': 'Use cfgfilter to hide transport opts from API

  rpc_backend

oslo.messaging 1.4.0 for Juno.

Also note that oslo.messaging.ConfFixture still registers all options
with the supplied ConfigOpts instead (ensuring that e.g. set_override()
works as expected) so the options will not be private in unit tests.

Finally, this uses cfgfilter from oslo-incubator but we should not
merge this until we are using cfgfilter from oslo.config proper.

Change-Id: I9c3bf74f13a820ce295aa77a2bbcd781778b5926
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Use cfgfilter to hide transport opts from API

Make use of the new cfgfilter module to ensure that the following
configuration options are not visible via the ConfigOpts instance
you pass to get_transport() or TransportURL.parse():

  transport_url
  control_exchange
  rpc_backend

Note that this may break some applications using oslo.messaging
currently but only because they depended on API semantics which were
documented as private. That said, we should ensure that integrated
OpenStack projects stable/icehose branches are fixed before we release
oslo.messaging 1.4.0 for Juno.

Also note that oslo.messaging.ConfFixture still registers all options
with the supplied ConfigOpts instead (ensuring that e.g. set_override()
works as expected) so the options will not be private in unit tests.

Finally, this uses cfgfilter from oslo-incubator but we should not
merge this until we are using cfgfilter from oslo.config proper.

Change-Id: I9c3bf74f13a820ce295aa77a2bbcd781778b5926

commit_message:
Add a hook to load glance_store options

The backends configuration options are now in the glance_store package
and are loaded at runtime. This patch adds a hook that calls a
glance_store function to load the options.

Change-Id: Iefd49afd578f2b5fa9318d8ed8fb9f7a76d8ba34

commit_message:
Don't check the network connectivity when SHUTOFF

test_server_connectivity_stop_start stops a server and checks the
network connectivity after SHUTOFF status.
When stopping a server, nova-api sends stop_instance message to
nova-cpu internally and nova-cpu powers off the server. So the test
should not check the connectivity because the ssh service also would
be disabled.

Change-Id: I0fd4b177a413eb899d051935589ecb77b06f707c
Related-Bug: #1323658

subject: Correct the default order of update versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6719, 'name': 'tatyana-leontovich', 'email': 'tleontovich@mirantis.com', 'username': 'tatyana-leontovich'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10136, 'name': 'Andrey Sledzinskiy', 'email': 'asledzinskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asledzinskiy'}, {'_account_id': 11081, 'name': 'Artem Panchenko', 'email': 'artem@panchenko.email', 'username': 'apanchenko'}, {'_account_id': 12129, 'name': 'Kirill Omelchenko', 'email': 'komelchenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'komelchenko'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 13:39:37.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/helpers/checkers.py'], 'message': "Correct the default order of update versions

1) Implements sorting releases in 'get_releases_list_for_os'.
 When RELEASE_VERSION is not set, 'get_releases_list_for_os'
returns list of releases in unsorted order which is caused
selecting a wrong release to update (5.0 tries updating to
5.1 because id=3 & 4 are for 5.1 and id=5 & 6 are for 5.0.2)

2) Add ability to get full list of packages with
'get_package_versions_from_node' if 'name' is not set.

3) Remove verbose flag from untar function to avoid stucking
of remote command executing due to a lot of stdout output.

Change-Id: I5dcf2f020a84ab132d6802a7cb9367e81c9f02b1
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct the default order of update versions

1) Implements sorting releases in 'get_releases_list_for_os'.
 When RELEASE_VERSION is not set, 'get_releases_list_for_os'
returns list of releases in unsorted order which is caused
selecting a wrong release to update (5.0 tries updating to
5.1 because id=3 & 4 are for 5.1 and id=5 & 6 are for 5.0.2)

2) Add ability to get full list of packages with
'get_package_versions_from_node' if 'name' is not set.

3) Remove verbose flag from untar function to avoid stucking
of remote command executing due to a lot of stdout output.

Change-Id: I5dcf2f020a84ab132d6802a7cb9367e81c9f02b1

commit_message:
Update Heat CLI test to pass with random hash

The failing test assumes ordering of the returned JSON
blob and asserts that the given server resource precedes
another resource.  This updates it and allows the test
to pass when the resource is listed at the end of the
section, which may happen depending on hash + dict
ordering.

Change-Id: I279a1a1f3081214b0a2b0f712d311d148acd7b8e

Extract RabbitMQ config files from install.d to files/

Separate config files out of the install.d script into files/.
This is more readable.

commit_message:
Let zake act as a in-memory fully functional driver

The zake driver should theoretically function the same as the
non-local driver so all the same kazoo functions should work,
without the whole distributed part as they work with the regular
zookeeper backed kazoo driver.

Change-Id: I19df0da0e58c5624ca1b10f61c42510f1f104847

commit_message:
Don't expose X-Auth-Token in glance CLI

Glance CLI exposes X-Auth-Token in debug mode. This patch replaces
X-Auth-Token's value with '{SHA1}<sha1oftoken>'. Some credentials
are exposed by keystoneclient as glanceclient uses keystoneclient
to authenticate, it will be fixed in bug-100414.

Change-Id: Ia51c578d20a96aae143d86893a45134643bd4053
Closes-Bug: #1327019

commit_message:
Update ironic states and documentation

This adds doc strings for the various states, and updates the documentation
header to reflect the current state of states.

In addition, this removes the following unused states:
  - INIT
  - BUILDING
  - SUSPEND

Change-Id: Id7493e856504f5ccf67fe7a716d748ffa7248590
Closes-Bug: #1308207

commit_message:
Not permitted to delete pools which are used by flavor

Pool will be used when creating a flavor, in this case
use is not permitted to delete the pool except after
removing the relationship either by patching the flavor
to change the pool it used or deleting the flavor.

DocsImpact
Pool deletion can now fail with 403 if the pool is used by flavor

Change-Id: I8db78a0f55602a865f98eecb0035b139f1ab18b1
Closes-Bug: #1362174

commit_message:
Renaming 'stop_workflow' to 'pause_workflow'

* Renamed method 'stop_workflow' to 'pause_workflow' for engine
  and workflow handler.
* Renamed state 'STOPPED' to 'PAUSED' according to the name of
  engine instruction 'pause'

commit_message:
Parametrize Swift partition power

The Swift partition power is currently hard-coded to 10.  While
this is fine for small Swift clusters there are some users who
will want to configure rings with higher partition powers.  We
have parametrized the value of the partition power, and the
default is set to 10.

Change-Id: If115cf5cf2f4c2ff7d28b0f5ae3d2ca3f4b4be5a

commit_message:
Only start zookeeper/memcached when not already running

Since openstack infra already runs these services (or will)
we should just use them when we can. Also for developers that
already have these services running we should use them when
we can instead of trying to recreate them.

Change-Id: I8655e5365ad36c57836f87e147102e2d02db7830

commit_message:
Fix volume name in 'test_volume_create' method

Default volume name was changed to 'ostf-test-volume'
by the commit # 00093c618ec2d013cfa964059c82c445cede068b
and this has led to permanently fail of OSTF check 'Create
volume and attach it to instance'.

Change-Id: Id9e514cc0b6ab60a4bbca33929f58afccf96bd4b
Closes-bug: #1369625

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-23 20:52:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'An initial implementation of a 1.0 based messaging driver

This change adds a new RPC backend as an option for devstack.  This
new RPC backend is the Qpid Dispatch Router.  It is a lightweight
message router that supports the AMQP 1.0 protocol.  For more
information, see
http://qpid.apache.org/components/dispatch-router/index.html

This new backend is necessary in order to test the new AMQP 1.0
oslo.messaging transport as described in the blueprint.

Change-Id: Ib8dea59922844e87d6c947b5dca557f5b5fc1160
Implements: blueprint amqp10-driver-implementation
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-01 17:50:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow tests of the AMQP 1.0 based olso.messaging driver

This change adds a configuration option that sets the messaging
protocol that is used by the RPC backend and client.

Some brokers can support different kinds of 'on the wire' messaging
protocols.  Qpid, for example, supports both AMQP 0-10 (the default),
and AMQP 1.0.  Use the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL configuration variable
to override the default protocol for those brokers that support
multiple protocol options.

This new option is necessary in order to test the new AMQP 1.0
oslo.messaging transport as described in the blueprint.

Change-Id: Ib8dea59922844e87d6c947b5dca557f5b5fc1160
Implements: blueprint amqp10-driver-implementation
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-09-10 15:13:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add an option to enable version 1.0 of the AMQP messaging protocol

This change adds the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL configuration option that
selects the messaging protocol that is used by the RPC backend and
client.

Some brokers can support different kinds of 'on the wire' messaging
protocols.  Qpid, for example, supports both AMQP 0-10 (the default),
and AMQP 1.0.  Use the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL configuration variable
to override the default protocol for those brokers that support
multiple protocol options.

This new option is necessary in order to enable the new AMQP 1.0
oslo.messaging transport as described in the blueprint.

Note well: currently this AMQP 1.0 functionality is only available on
fedora 19+ platforms.  Support is WIP on ubuntu/debian and rhel/centos
7. Enabling the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL option on an unsupported
platform will cause devstack to exit with an approriate error
message.

Change-Id: Ib8dea59922844e87d6c947b5dca557f5b5fc1160
Implements: blueprint amqp10-driver-implementation
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-09-10 19:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms/qpid', 'lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': "Add an option to enable version 1.0 of the AMQP messaging protocol

selects the messaging protocol that is used by the RPC backend and

Implements: blueprint amqp10-driver-implementation

commit_message:
Add an option to enable version 1.0 of the AMQP messaging protocol

This change adds the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL configuration option that
selects the messaging protocol that is used by the RPC backend and
client.

Some brokers can support different kinds of 'on the wire' messaging
protocols.  Qpid, for example, supports both AMQP 0-10 (the default),
and AMQP 1.0.  Use the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL configuration variable
to override the default protocol for those brokers that support
multiple protocol options.

This new option is necessary in order to enable the new AMQP 1.0
oslo.messaging transport as described in the blueprint.

Note well: currently this AMQP 1.0 functionality is only available on
fedora 19+ platforms.  Support is WIP on ubuntu/debian and rhel/centos
7. Enabling the RPC_MESSAGING_PROTOCOL option on an unsupported
platform will cause devstack to exit with an approriate error
message.

Change-Id: Ib8dea59922844e87d6c947b5dca557f5b5fc1160
Implements: blueprint amqp10-driver-implementation

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-12 10:05:33.000000000', 'files': ['.gitreview', 'zaqar/queues/storage/redis/utils.py', 'zaqar/queues/storage/redis/driver.py', 'zaqar/queues/storage/redis/options.py'], 'message': ' Redis driver does not failover to slave when master fails

 Add the ability to configure Sentinel support in zaqar.conf

 Read that config and use it to construct a Sentinel instance and discover
 the master in lieu of instantiating StrictRedis directly

 Test master-slave failover

 Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver

Change-Id: I661269b2a04c6e48dcb1d76a0c21f17224e7b3a1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Redis driver does not failover to slave when master fails

 Add the ability to configure Sentinel support in zaqar.conf

 Read that config and use it to construct a Sentinel instance and discover
 the master in lieu of instantiating StrictRedis directly

 Test master-slave failover

 Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver

Change-Id: I661269b2a04c6e48dcb1d76a0c21f17224e7b3a1

commit_message:
Refactor oneline changelog walking.

We want to suck the changelog into the description as well, but we
don't want all of it there. Making it a generator of formatted
objects lets us apply some logic without conflating things or tying
it up too much. This patch does prep work for the long term goal.

Change-Id: Idd00c219891500210c83faeb0f2d4370add3b069

commit_message:
Allow DHCPv6 reply from server to client

Add security group rule to allow DHCPv6 reply from dhcp server
link local addres port 547 to client port 546.

Change-Id: I5fd9561e855b1d3999649934977af659d5ca221f
Closes-Bug: 1335984

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-06 21:28:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add retry_on_deadlock to db update methods

There's some known races that have been addressed in
Nova via a retry_on_deadlock deocrator.  Some known
cases in Cinder exist as well when dealing with updates
to quotas and reservations_expire.

This patch introduces the decorator to Cinder and hits
the methods known to be susceptible to deadlock as well
as some others that seem as though they'd fall into the
same category.

Leverages work that's already been done in Nova

Co-Authored-By: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic807f4f8a333e4d5477f86e41eea40191637087c
Partial-bug: #1350466
(cherry picked from commit 201adf31a57ea4d456ef5daf1eca2ed3b64fca85)

commit_message:
Add retry_on_deadlock to db update methods

There's some known races that have been addressed in
Nova via a retry_on_deadlock deocrator.  Some known
cases in Cinder exist as well when dealing with updates
to quotas and reservations_expire.

This patch introduces the decorator to Cinder and hits
the methods known to be susceptible to deadlock as well
as some others that seem as though they'd fall into the
same category.

Leverages work that's already been done in Nova

Co-Authored-By: Vish Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic807f4f8a333e4d5477f86e41eea40191637087c
Partial-bug: #1350466
(cherry picked from commit 201adf31a57ea4d456ef5daf1eca2ed3b64fca85)

commit_message:
Add fix for reservation index to icehouse

Cinder doesn't have backportable migrations, so ensure the index
is added every time the migration runs.

DB migration in master that does the same thing was made in the
following commits:
  4d56b91628518629b47997b93acd9cb1e48f87f5
  08b90190085a11bc99112472944c193672061e1f
  479d6050f3f07e12488e6bb9a40b0aec3452a19c

Change-Id: I8bdab1a70f0076312aba4d0b6c4417b335947680
Resolves-bug: #1348720

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-24 15:01:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Configuration token hashing algorithm

The user's authentication token was hashed using the MD5 algorithm.
The MD5 algorithm shouldn't be used because of the potential for
hash collisions. Some security standards mandate a SHA2 algorithm
or better must be used.

With this change the algorithm to use for hashing tokens can be
configured by setting the OPENSTACK_TOKEN_HASH_ALGORITHM
configuration option to a hash algorithm supported by Python's
hashlib library[1]. For example, a deployer could set the option to
'sha256' to meet a SHA2 security standard.

The algorithm chosen must match the hash algorithm that the
identity server is configured to use (Keystone and the auth_token
middleware can be configured to use any hash algorithm supported by
hashlib).

This is for security hardening.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/hashlib.html

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I9e3eba7e0a12ae40a08d0ed851ea916ec6591bcc
Closes-Bug: #1174499

commit_message:
Configurable token hashing algorithm

The user's authentication token was hashed using the MD5 algorithm.
The MD5 algorithm shouldn't be used because of the potential for
hash collisions. Some security standards mandate a SHA2 algorithm
or better must be used.

With this change the algorithm to use for hashing tokens can be
configured by setting the OPENSTACK_TOKEN_HASH_ALGORITHM
configuration option to a hash algorithm supported by Python's
hashlib library[1]. For example, a deployer could set the option to
'sha256' to meet a SHA2 security standard.

The algorithm chosen must match the hash algorithm that the
identity server is configured to use (Keystone and the auth_token
middleware can be configured to use any hash algorithm supported by
hashlib).

This is for security hardening.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/hashlib.html

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I9e3eba7e0a12ae40a08d0ed851ea916ec6591bcc
Closes-Bug: #1174499
